snippet.textDisplay: Probably the first game I bought a new computer for just to play.  It most definitely was worth it.  As an immense fan of the original DOOM games, I found this game to be absolutely delightful and remind me of times when games, for me, could live up to the hype I gave them.
snippet.textOriginal: Probably the first game I bought a new computer for just to play.  It most definitely was worth it.  As an immense fan of the original DOOM games, I found this game to be absolutely delightful and remind me of times when games, for me, could live up to the hype I gave them.

snippet.textDisplay: Doom 3's a pretty solid game on it's own, but it doesn't hold a candle to Doom 1, 2 or 64.
snippet.textOriginal: Doom 3's a pretty solid game on it's own, but it doesn't hold a candle to Doom 1, 2 or 64.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with you Supra. The game did stray quite a ways away from its predecessors however it was still a very fun game with some great music and graphics.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree with you Supra. The game did stray quite a ways away from its predecessors however it was still a very fun game with some great music and graphics.

snippet.textDisplay: I recommend everyone to play any of the Doom games.
snippet.textOriginal: I recommend everyone to play any of the Doom games.

snippet.textDisplay: your list has made me find so many games that I need to play and I thank you for that. Now my backlog is even bigger.
snippet.textOriginal: your list has made me find so many games that I need to play and I thank you for that. Now my backlog is even bigger.

snippet.textDisplay: Finding good and memorable music for some of these horror games is proving difficult. Doom 3 was and remains a divisive game. While some people hated it and thought it completely strayed away from the prequels (and I can't disagree), I simply enjoyed my time with this game back when it came out. Lights turned off and headphones plugged in, I was in for some very intense and scary moments inside the Mars labs. I couldn't believe how great the graphics were and it definitely reinforced the game's horror aspect. I generally couldn't play through more than 2 levels at a time before I felt like I had to take a break. The gameplay was plain fun and I loved a mechanic that a lot of people hated : not being able to pull out your guns at the same time as the flashlight. I thought it added a very interesting layer to the exploration, never making you feel completely safe. As for the other games in this series, I'd probably put Doom 64 in my Top 15.
snippet.textOriginal: Finding good and memorable music for some of these horror games is proving difficult. Doom 3 was and remains a divisive game. While some people hated it and thought it completely strayed away from the prequels (and I can't disagree), I simply enjoyed my time with this game back when it came out. Lights turned off and headphones plugged in, I was in for some very intense and scary moments inside the Mars labs. I couldn't believe how great the graphics were and it definitely reinforced the game's horror aspect. I generally couldn't play through more than 2 levels at a time before I felt like I had to take a break. The gameplay was plain fun and I loved a mechanic that a lot of people hated : not being able to pull out your guns at the same time as the flashlight. I thought it added a very interesting layer to the exploration, never making you feel completely safe. As for the other games in this series, I'd probably put Doom 64 in my Top 15.

snippet.textDisplay: I will always say that a great idea for a horror game would be where you play as a bigger monster hunting other monsters. I will stick to my guns on that, someone make that game.
snippet.textOriginal: I will always say that a great idea for a horror game would be where you play as a bigger monster hunting other monsters. I will stick to my guns on that, someone make that game.

snippet.textDisplay: @Medal Melodies No, I'd prefer something completely different than another horror game taking place in space labs. We've now gotten enough of those.
snippet.textOriginal: @Medal Melodies No, I'd prefer something completely different than another horror game taking place in space labs. We've now gotten enough of those.

snippet.textDisplay: So with this in mind, would you want a Doom sequel that is designed in the same style as this game?
